actions-list.actionItem: The Committee of the Whole resumed with debate on H.R. 1.
Subsequently, the Committee of the Whole resumed it's sitting.
The Committee of the Whole rose informally to receive a message from the President.
The Committee of the Whole proceeded with seven hours of general debate on H.R. 1.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Darrell Issa to act as Chairman of the Committee.
House resolved itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H. Res. 260 and Rule XVIII.
Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1 with 7 hours of general debate. Motion to recommit allowed. Measure will be considered read. Specified amendments are in order.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 260. H.R. 1 — "To lower energy costs by increasing American energy production, exports, infrastructure, and critical minerals processing, by promoting transparency, accountability, permitting, and production of American resources, and by improving water quality certification and energy projects, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 218
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 218

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 260 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1) to lower energy costs by increasing American energy production, exports, infrastructure, and critical minerals processing, by promoting transparency, accountability, permitting, and production of American resources, and by improving water quality certification and energy projects, and for other purposes."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 28.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess for a period of less than 15 minutes.

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 260, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question on H. Res. 260 and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 260.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 260 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1) to lower energy costs by increasing American energy production, exports, infrastructure, and critical minerals processing, by promoting transparency, accountability, permitting, and production of American resources, and by improving water quality certification and energy projects, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 28.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for approximately 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Jake LaTurner to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
